com.ooyala.android.item

Class Stream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ooyala.android.item.Stream

  • public class Stream
extends java.lang.Object
    Stream represents a single playable video URL. This refers to the Video URL, and any metadata around that particular video. NOTE: When reading Streams that are generated from Ooyala Backlot APIs, A lot of the fields within this class apply solely to Streams with MP4 Delivery Type

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stream

        public Stream()
        Create an empty Stream object

      • Stream

        public Stream(org.json.JSONObject data)

      • Stream

        public Stream(org.json.JSONObject data,
              boolean fromAsset)
        Create a Stream Object based on a provided JSON Object. Take a look at Stream's static class variables that are prefixed with "KEY_" to understand the acceptable JSONObject entries
        Parameters:
        data - a JSONObject with proper entries for a Stream

      • Stream

        public Stream(java.lang.String url,
              java.lang.String deliveryType)
        Create an Stream that simply contains URL and Delivery Type This is the bare minimum for the instantiation of an UnbundledVideo object
        Parameters:
        url - source for the video stream e.g. "http://techslides.com/demos/sample-videos/small.mp4".
        deliveryType - the stream delivery type e.g. DELIVERY_TYPE_MP4. See Stream's class variables that are prefixed with "DELIVERY_TYPE"

    • Method Detail

      • setStreamSelector

        public static void setStreamSelector(StreamSelector selector)
        Set the StreamSelector used to select the Stream to play.
        Parameters:
        selector - an implemented StreamSelector

      • resetStreamSelector

        public static void resetStreamSelector()
        Reset the StreamSelector to the default

      • getDeliveryType

        public java.lang.String getDeliveryType()
        Get the Delivery type of this Stream instance
        Returns:
        the String of the Delivery Type. the available options are the Stream's class variables which are prefixed with "DELIVERY_TYPE"

      • setDeliveryType

        public void setDeliveryType(java.lang.String deliveryType)
        Set the Delivery type of this Stream instance
        Parameters:
        deliveryType - the String of the Delivery Type. the available options are the Stream's class variables which are prefixed with "DELIVERY_TYPE"

      • getUrlFormat

        public java.lang.String getUrlFormat()
        Get the URL format for this Stream Instance
        Returns:
        the URL format. the available options are the Stream's class variables which are prefixed with "STREAM_URL_FORMAT"

      • setUrlFormat

        public void setUrlFormat(java.lang.String urlFormat)
        Set the URL format for this Stream instance
        Parameters:
        urlFormat - the URL format. the available options are the Stream's class variables which are prefixed with "STREAM_URL_FORMAT"

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        Get the video URL from this Stream instance The returned string could be encoded or unencoded, based on the URL Format field.
        Returns:
        the video url, or encoded string

      • setUrl

        public void setUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Set the video URL of this Stream instance If the video url is encoded, make sure you set the urlFormat
        Parameters:
        url - the video url, or encoded string

      • decodedURL

        public java.net.URL decodedURL()
        Get the unencoded video URL for the stream, whether it is encoded or not.
        Returns:
        the unencoded video URL

      • setWidevineServerPath

        public void setWidevineServerPath(java.lang.String widevineServerPath)
        Set the Widevine Server Path of this content for downloaded assets. This field is only populated for Widevine encoded assets
        Parameters:
        widevineServerPath - the Widevine server path

      • getWidevineServerPath

        public java.lang.String getWidevineServerPath()
        Get the Widevine Server Path of this content. This field is only populated for Widevine encoded assets
        Returns:
        the Widevine server path, if available

      • getWidevineUUID

        public java.util.UUID getWidevineUUID()
        Get the Widevine UUID of this content. This field is only populated for Widevine encoded assets
        Returns:
        the Widevine UUID, if available

      • initWidevineUUID

        public void initWidevineUUID()
        Init the Widevine UUID of this content. This field is only populated for Widevine encoded assets

      • isLiveStream

        public boolean isLiveStream()
        Return true if the Stream has been marked as a live stream.
        Returns:
        true if the stream is marked as a live stream, false otherwise

      • setLiveStream

        public void setLiveStream(boolean isLiveStream)
        Set if the Stream is marked as a live stream
        Parameters:
        isLiveStream - true if the stream is live, false otherwise

      • getVideoBitrate

        public int getVideoBitrate()
        Get the video bitrate of this Stream instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated
        Returns:
        the video bitrate (MP4 Only)

      • setVideoBitrate

        public void setVideoBitrate(int videoBitrate)
        Set the video bitrate of this Stream instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated
        Parameters:
        videoBitrate - (MP4 Only)

      • getAudioBitrate

        public int getAudioBitrate()
        Get the audio bitrate of this Stream instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated
        Returns:
        the audio bitrate (MP4 Only)

      • setAudioBitrate

        public void setAudioBitrate(int audioBitrate)
        Set the audio bitrate of this Stream instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated
        Parameters:
        audioBitrate - the audio bitrate (MP4 Only)

      • getCombinedBitrate

        public int getCombinedBitrate()
        Get the combined audio and video bitrate for this stream If AudioBitrate = # & VideoBitrate = # Then the combined bitrate = AudioBitrate + VideoBitrate If AudioBitrate = -1 & VideoBitrate = # Then the combined bitrate = VideoBitrate only If AudioBitrate = # & VideoBitrate = -1 Then the combined bitrate = AudioBitrate only If AudioBitrate = -1 & VideoBitrate = -1 Then the combined bitrate = -1
        Returns:
        the combined audio and video bitrate

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the height of this Stream instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated
        Returns:
        the height (MP4 Only)

      • getProfile

        public java.lang.String getProfile()
        Get the encoding profile of this Stream Instance NOTE: Only has information for MP4 assets. Other formats may not have this field populated

      • setProfile

        Parameters:

      • isDeliveryTypePlayable

        public static boolean isDeliveryTypePlayable(Stream stream)
        Determine if the video type is playable on this this Android OS Version Primarily checks if the delivery type is one of the expected delivery types, or if the type is HLS, if the Android OS is above 3.0,
        Parameters:
        stream - the Stream instance to test against
        Returns:
        true if the Stream instance's delivery type should be playable, false otherwise

      • isProfilePlayable

        public static boolean isProfilePlayable(Stream stream)
        Determine if the encoding profile is playable This check is primarily for MP4 Playback - If the mp4 is not Baseline, we do not play it on Android
        Parameters:
        stream - the Stream instance to test against
        Returns:
        true if the Stream instance's profile should be playable, false otherwise

      • bestStream

        public static Stream bestStream(java.util.Set<Stream> streams,
                                boolean isWifiEnabled)
        Determine the best stream from a set of streams. If there are multiple streams, we prioritize remote assets, HLS, and DASH streams. Outside of that, we then priortize Smooth, and finally MP4 streams
        Parameters:
        streams - a set of Streams to test against
        isWifiEnabled - If wifi is enabled, we choose the highest quality of all MP4 bitrates
        Returns:
        the best stream to play back.

      • streamSetContainsDeliveryType

        public static boolean streamSetContainsDeliveryType(java.util.Set<Stream> streams,
                                                    java.lang.String deliveryType)
        Check the set of Streams to see if any of the Streams are of a specific delivery type
        Parameters:
        streams - a set of Streams to test against
        deliveryType - the desired Delivery Type
        Returns:
        true if the set of streams contain the desired deliveryType

      • getStreamWithDeliveryType

        public static Stream getStreamWithDeliveryType(java.util.Set<Stream> streams,
                                               java.lang.String desiredType)
        Get a Stream that has the desired type
        Parameters:
        streams - a set of Streams
        desiredType - the desired type
        Returns:
        a Stream that satisfy the desired type, null otherwise

      • hasTokenExpired

        public boolean hasTokenExpired(long currentTimeMillisecond)
        check if the stream url token has expired
        Parameters:
        currentTimeMillisecond - current time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        true if url token expires, false otherwise
